coveredBy.description: The treaties, laws, regulations or other instruments that the initiation is covered by, extracted automatically against country of jurisdiction

id.description: ID for this release

internalId.description: Internal identifier for this PCR according to Procuring Entity classification

description.description: Free-text relevant description for this PCR

status.description: Status of PCR from [Codelists#PCR statuses|codelist] according to state-chart diagram

procurementMethodModalities.description: The set of modalities for this PCR

procurementMethodDetails.description: The machine-readable name of the initiated process

procurementMethodRationale.description: Free-text justification of applied procurement method by Procuring Entity

mainProcurementCategory.description: Main procurement category indicated according to the classification of the subject of procurement

tenderPeriod.description: The period for submission of the pre-award catalogues by invited suppliers

enquiryPeriod.description: The period for enquiries from invited suppliers

procuringEntity.description: Reference to the entity resonsible for this PCR

documents.description: Any documents attached to this PCR by PE

classification.description: Classification of group of goods requested by this PCR under current category. Usually it is a certain group detailed up to 6th CPV digit - code of one of nodes of establishment

lotGroups.description: Where Procuring Entity reserves the right to combine lots a lot group is used to capture this information.

lots.description: Each described node is a lot with a included attributes describing an attributes according to the structure of the Lot definition inheritence

positions.title: Tender.Positions
positions.description: Positions - number of specific positions (known in advance), related to one or more profiles described under this PCR and expected to be proposed by invited suppliers with actual unit prices and conditions of delivery by submitting their pre-award catalogues

targets.description: An array of targets related to specific item and capture its specification as SKU

items.description: Each described position is an item with a included attributes

documents.description: Any documents related to the positions

profiles.description: Profiles - are varieties defined by Procuring Entity for this node together with related targets and criteria under specific pre-award catalogue request

id.title: Tender ID
id.description: An identifier for this tender process. This may be the same as the ocid

internalId.description: An internal identifier of this tender process drawn from an internally held identifier for this tender.

description.title: Tender description
description.description: Tender description

status.title: Tender status
status.description: The current status of the tender based on the [tenderStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#tender-status)

procurementMethodModalities.title: Procurement method modalities
procurementMethodModalities.description: The modalities of the procurement method.

items.title: Items to be procured
items.description: The goods and services to be purchased, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.

procurementMethod.title: Procurement method
procurementMethod.description: Specify tendering method against the [method codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#method) as per [GPA definitions](http://www.wto.org/english/docs_e/legal_e/rev-gpr-94_01_e.htm) of Open, Selective, Limited

procurementMethodDetails.title: Procurement method details
procurementMethodDetails.description: Additional detail on the procurement method used. This field may be used to provide the local name of the particular procurement method used.

procurementMethodRationale.title: Procurement method rationale
procurementMethodRationale.description: Rationale of procurement method, especially in the case of Limited tendering.

mainProcurementCategory.title: Procurement category
mainProcurementCategory.description: The primary category describing the object of this contracting process from the [procurementCategory](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#procurement-category) codelist (e.g. supplies, works, services, consultingServices or mixed).

awardCriteria.title: Award criteria
awardCriteria.description: Specify the award criteria for the procurement, using the [award criteria codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#award-criteria)

awardCriteriaDetails.title: Award criteria details
awardCriteriaDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the award or selection criteria.

submissionMethod.title: Submission method
submissionMethod.description: Specify the method by which bids must be submitted, in person, written, or electronic auction. Using the [submission method codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#submission-method)

submissionMethodDetails.title: Submission method details
submissionMethodDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the submission method. This may include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids should be submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions.

enquiries.title: Enquiries
enquiries.description: Questions sent to the procuring entity, and the answers given

hasEnquiries.title: Has enquiries?
hasEnquiries.description: A true/false field to indicate whether any enquiries were received during the tender process. Structured information on enquiries that were received, and responses to them, can be provided using the enquiries extension.

eligibilityCriteria.title: Eligibility criteria
eligibilityCriteria.description: A description of any eligibility criteria for potential suppliers.

numberOfTenderers.title: Number of tenderers
numberOfTenderers.description: The number of entities who submit a tender.

tenderers.title: Tenderers
tenderers.description: All entities who submit a bid on a tender. More detailed information on bids and the bidding organisation can be provided using the optional bid extension.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the tender, including any notices. See the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#document-type) for details of potential documents to include.

milestones.title: Milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the tender.

amendments.description: A tender amendment is a formal change to the tender, and generally involves the publication of a new tender notice/release. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

lots.title: Lots
lots.description: A tender process may be divided into lots, where bidders can bid on one or more lots. Details of each lot can be provided here. Items, documents and other features can then reference the lot they are related to using relatedLot. Where no relatedLot identifier is given, the values should be interpreted as applicable to the whole tender. Properties of tender can be overridden for a given Lot through their inclusion in the Lot object.

lotGroups.title: Lot groups
lotGroups.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

participationFees.title: Participation fees
participationFees.description: Any fees applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees may apply for access to bidding documents, for the submission of bids or there may be a win fee payable by the successful bidder.

criteria.description: A list of criteria on which either bidders or items will be judged, evaluated or assessed.

submissionLanguages.title: Submission Languages
submissionLanguages.description: Language(s) in which tenderers may submit, drawn from the [submissionLanguages codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#submission-languages)

targets.title: Targets
targets.description: Any target metrics for this results of this contracting process.

procurementMethodModalitiesDetails.title: Procurement Method Modalities Details
procurementMethodModalitiesDetails.description: The prescribed presets of settings and adjustments for the differement procurement methods modalities applied under this contracting process

electronicAuction.title: Electronic Auction Modalities
electronicAuction.description: The prescribed presets of settings and adjustments available for the electronic auction as one one of the procurement methods modalities applied under this contracting process

conversions.title: Conversions
conversions.description: A list of weightings for the used criteria or applicable options

complaints.title: Comlaints
complaints.description: Any comlaints related to this tender

coveredBy.title: Covered by
coveredBy.description: The treaties, laws, regulations or other instruments that the contracting process is covered by.

Unit.title: Unit
Unit.description: A description of the unit in which the supplies, services or works are provided (e.g. hours, kilograms) and the unit-price. For comparability, an established list of units can be used.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The list from which units of measure identifiers are taken. Use of the scheme 'UNCEFACT' for the UN/CEFACT Recommendation 20 list of 'Codes for Units of Measure Used in International Trade' is recommended.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier from the codelist referenced in the scheme property. For example, with UNCEFACT, this is the value of the 'Common Code' column. From this identifier, applications can look-up the human readable name or symbol for this unit of measure.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: If the scheme used provide a machine-readable URI for this unit of measure, this can be given.

hasVariants.description: A True/False field to indicate if any variants will be accepted for this node

variantDetails.description: Further information about the variants that will be accepted

hasVariants.title: Lot Variants
hasVariants.description: A True/False field to indicate if lot variants will be accepted. Required by the EU

variantDetails.title: Lot variant details
variantDetails.description: Further information about the lot variants that will be accepted. Required by the EU

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency for each amount should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

exchangeRates.title: Exchange rates
exchangeRates.description: Used to specify any [ExchangeRate] used, or to be used, to convert from amount to an alternative currency. To include alternative currency values within the data itself, add an 'amount_CODE' property alongside amount (e.g. amount_USD). See the extension documentation for more details.

valueAddedTaxIncluded.title: A true/false field to indicate whether the value tax was included

ValueBreakdown.title: Value Breakdown
ValueBreakdown.description: The breakdown of known and/or estimated values in this contract.

id.title: id
id.description: The identifier of this value breakdown. Unique within this array.

type.title: type
type.description: A value from the valueType codelist that identifies the nature of the value in the breakdown. Negative values indicate a revenue to the supplier.

description.title: description
description.description: The description of this value breakdown.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: An classification should be drawn from an existing scheme or list of codes. This field is used to indicate the scheme/codelist from which the classification is drawn.

id.title: ID
id.description: The classification code drawn from the selected scheme.

description.title: Description
description.description: A textual description or title for the code.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to identify the code. In the event individual URIs are not available for items in the identifier scheme this value should be left blank.

id.description: An identifier for this coefficient.

value.description: Value of related 'requirement' or one of available 'options' if applicable received through 'requirementResponse'

minValue.description: Indicative minimum value of related 'requirement' or one of available 'options' if applicable received through 'requirementResponse'

maxValue.description: Indicative maximum value of related 'requirement' or one of available 'options' if applicable received through 'requirementResponse'

period.description: Used to specify a particular [Period] the conversion and its coefficients are applies to

coefficient.description: Precise value that has to be applied for conversion in specific case

formula.description: Where mathematical formula is used to calculate precise value that has to be applied for conversion in specific case this field must be populated with such formula

validationRules.rule: At least one group described for this conversion
Specified value MUST be taken from the relevant codelist
Where 'relatesTo': 'item' specified value MUST be in an array of 'items'
Where 'relatesTo': 'lot', specified value MUST be in an array of 'lots'
Sepcified value MUST be unique for each element in 'conversions' array

id.description: An identifier for this conversion

rationale.description: The free-text rationale of using of this conversion

description.description: Any free-text description from PE for this conversion

relatesTo.description: The schema element that the conversion applies. For example, the conversion may be defined against a requirement or against a metric.

relatedItem.description: Where 'relatesTo' is not empty this field must be populated with the id of the item in this tender section which the conversion relates to.

coefficients.description: A list of [Coefficient] for this Conversion

validationRules.rule: Specified value MUST be from enum of relevant schema elements
At least one group MUST be described for this criterion
Specified value MUST be from enum of relevant schema elements
Specified value MUST be from enum of relevant schema elements
Specified value MUST have same dataType specified with 'dataType' for this criterion
Specified value MUST be 'number' or 'integer' where 'minValue' applied for this criterion
Specified value MUST be 'number' or 'integer' where 'maxValue' applied for this criterion
'minValue' attribute CAN NOT be applied where 'exepctedValue' is defined for this criterion
'maxValue' attribute CAN NOT be applied where 'exepctedValue' is defined for this criterion
Value for 'maxValue' MUST be higher then value for 'minValue' is defined for this criterion

id.description: An identifier for this criterion

description.description: Any free-text description from PE while preparing this criterion

classification.description: The structured classification of this criterion against applied model (e.g. ESPD)

source.description: Source of response to the requirements specificed in the criterion

relatesTo.description: The schema element that the criterion judges, evaluates or assesses.

relatedItem.description: Where relatesTo = "item" this field must be populated with the id of the item in this tender section which the criterion relates to.

requirementGroups.description: A list of [RequirementGroup] for this Criterion.

rate.title: Currency conversion rate
rate.description: The rate to use in converting amount to the alternative currency. Amount x Rate = Alternative Currency Amount.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The destination currency for conversion of amount. Currency should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

date.title: Exchange rate date
date.description: The date at which this exchange rate was current.

source.title: Exchange rate source
source.description: The source used to provide the value of the exchange rate, taken from the exchangeRateSource codelist.

isJointProcurement.description: A True/False field to indicate if this is a joint procurement or not. Required by the EU

country.description: ISO Country Code of the country where the law applies. Use ISO Alpha-2 country codes.

id.description: An identifier for this metric drawn from a codelist

description.description: Any free-text description from PE while preparing this target

relatesTo.description: The schema element that the target is related to

observations.description: An array of [Observation] for this target

rules.rule: At least one observation described for this metric

id.description: An identifier for this observation

period.description: The period over which this observation is measured

value.description: For financial metrics, the value of this forecast, target or observation.

measure.description: For non-financial metrics, the measure of this forecast, target or actual observation. Measures may be provided as free text or numerical values.

unit.description: Unit of measure for this observation

dimensions.description: Any number of dimensions can be recorded within this object. Dimensions names should follow the camelCase conventions of OCDS

relatedRequirementID.description: The reference of the requirement to which the observation is applicable to

VR-Observation.@-001.rule: Specified value found in an array of relevant schema-elements ('requirements') of this initiation
